channel.title: Help me make my first chill trap track
channel.description:
Hey guys, i’ve kinda run out of ideas for house and EDM tracks (what I mainly do) for now. I kinda wanna start to get into chill trap and similar genres but I really don’t have too much info on song structure and the rhythms that are characteristic of chill trap. I’ve been listening to great chill trap on soundcloud by @blackocean, @crystldawnmusic, and a few others but i’ve tried observing and trying my take on chill trap but kinda failed. So i’ve turned to you guys, the people I know the most, for some help on a completely new genre that I’m really foreign to. If you’ve got any info on how to make chill trap (i.e. which instruments, what tempo range, what styles of rhythms, etc.) please feel free to share them here so not just I can benefit from this but so can everyone else.
Thanks!

I need some help on snare rolls lol

Read full topic

item.title: Help me make my first chill trap track
item.dc:creator: anon73773654
item.description:
Ooh, great thread. I’m trying out some chills but stuff as well in my new track. The thing is, I’m kinda bad at the trap part. I did create a decent drum beat and a good snare roll for the drop though…

You guys have any suggestions on specifically the trap part?

Read full topic

item.title: Help me make my first chill trap track
item.dc:creator: blackocean
item.description:
100-120 BPM. Hour for sure (lowpass 1/3 reverb full and tone full) Noir piano (lowpass half, reverb and shape full) and dollar snare and dust kick and dust clave/woodblock full verb. (slot 7 and 8 in the kit) use 7ths and 9ths in the chords
if u need me to clarify anything just let me know ️:heart:️

Read full topic
item.source: Help me make my first chill trap track
